column3: The 6 primary Stats that compose your character, Physical: Str, Dex, and Con, and Mental: Int, Wis, and Cha.
Melee Damage/Shield Bonus, Melee Attack Rolls
Ranged/Finesse Damage/Shield Bonus, Ranged/Finesse Attack Rolls, Dodge
Spell Attack Rolls, Spell Damage Bonus, Max WP
Beneficial Spell Effects Mod, Negative Spell Effects Mod, Spell DC, Summoned Creature Stats,
Your Life, at Zero or below you become Incapacitated.
The amount of Willpower Generated when Resting or using the Focus Action. The amount of HP Recovered when Resting.
The number of Abilities you can use. Typically Abilities cost only 1WP, unless they can Target an Area or Multiple Enemies, Grant Buffs, Heal, or Apply Control Effects
The Bonuses granted to your Summoned Creatures and Devices
The maximum amount of unequipped items that can be carried. This does not count most materials or non-equipable items, and most consumables only take up Capacity when you have a Full Stack.
The number of Actions you can take on your Turn
You have an Addtional Action Point that can only be spent on certain Actions based on your Attribute Milestones
The number of Spaces you can move during a Movement Action
Increases the bonus to your Attack Rolls
Bonus to the base DC of your Spells and Effects
The lowest number Rolled when Attacking to Score a Critical Hit. Base is 20
The Number of Sides of the Dice Rolled when Dealing Damage or Healing
The Amount of Dice Rolled when Dealing Damage or Healing
The Amount of Damage added to all Damage Rolls, including the Modifier
The Number of Sides of a Bonus Dice Rolled when Dealing Damage or Healing

Protection Reduces Damage being Dealt. If a Damage type is not specified, the default is Physical (Slashing, Impact, and Piercing) Damage. Protection always reduces the Damage taken last, after Shields and Warding, and cannot reduce the Damage taken below 1, unless the Damage Blocked from a Shield Effect already Reduced the Damage below your Protection Value.

Shielded HP behaves like Hit Points, however any Damage other than True Damage must first reduce the Target's active Shield value to 0. Any remaining Damage then reduces the Target's HP after Protection. If the remaining Damage after destroying your Shield would not exceed your Protection, it deals no Damage to your HP. Effects that Grant Shielded HP do not Stack with one another, instead the Effect that Grants the most Shielded HP Ends the other Effects. The only exception to this is Shields that are Granted by a Reaction to taking Damage, like Blocking with a Shield. In this instance, the Shielded HP from your Reaction Reduces the Damage taken first, then the remaining Damage is Applied to Shielded HP Granted by a Status Effect.
The likelyhood most Area of Effect Abilities will hit you.
The likelyhood an Attack will Miss you. A cumulative total of your equiped Armor, Shield, and your Dex Mod (Armor dictates how much of your Dex Mod can be added).
The likelyhood most harmful Spells will affect you. (Wis Save)
The likelyhood you will maintain Concentration when damaged, or most harmful Physical Abilities will affect you, and the chance you can break free of Control Effects. (Con Save)
Reduces the Damage a Target takes from the specified Damage Type(s) by Half (rounded up). This always Reduces the Damage Taken first, before Shielded HP or Protection.
Reduces the Damage a Target takes from the specified Damage Type(s) to Zero. In addition, any Status Effects that would be Applied from an Ability of this Damage Type are Ignored.
Instead of taking Damage, the Target is Healed for Half the Damage dealt by a certain Damage Type

The specified Status Effects(s) have no affect on this Target. ie: Immune to Stuns means an Ability that Applies Stun could still hit the Target and deal Damage, but the Stun Effect would not be Applied.
You are Granted +3 Dodge, all Attacks and Perception Checks against you are made with Disadvantage, and your Dodge Saving Throws are made with Advantage.
When Incapacitated, Roll a DC10 Fortitude Save. If you Succeed 3 of these Saving Throws, you are Stablized. If you Fail 3, you are Dead.
When a Creature has less than Half (Rounded Up) of their Max HP they are considered Wounded and visibly appear as such to other Creatures.
When a Creature has more than Half (Rounded Up) of their Max HP they are considered Healthy and visibly appear as such to other Creatures.
The number of Spaces you can move during a Movement Action
A Space that prevents Movement and blocks Line of Sight in most cases.
Each Space of Difficult Terrain requires 2 Spaces of Movement to traverse.
Spend 1 AP to Move up to as many Spaces as your Speed

A Creature can move through a Space one size Smaller than itself (ie: a 2x2 Large Creature can move through a 1x1 Space like a doorway) can only do so at Half its Speed. This reduction does not 'Stack' with the reduction from Difficult Terrain, but Effects that Ignore Difficult Terrain do not ignore Squeezing
Spend 1 AP to Move 1 Space without Provoking Attacks of Opportunity
Make a DCX Athletics Check to move X+Str Spaces, or DCX Acrobatics Check to move Y(less)+Dex Spaces. These Movements Ignore Difficult Terrain.
A quick Movement associated with the use of an Ability
An instantaneous Movement associated with the use of an Ability that does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity.
A Movement caused by an external force against the Target's will that does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity.
An area made of Spaces, generally has a Shape associated with it. Ie: 2x2 Area Square or 3 Space Diamter Circle
90 Degree section of a Circle, Emanating in one of the 8 Cardinal Directions from the Caster or Target Area
Increased Charges for Primary Spells Attuned to Weapons
Your Summons now use Your Stat Modifiers or Theirs, Whichever is higher
DW Weapons without the Light Property in either hand, and/or Vers or 1h Heavy Weapons in your MH
1/2 Mod on OH Weapons and Shield
You can now use Recovery during a Short Rest.
Increases Base Power of your Recovery
Evasion (Reaction) - 1/2 damage on failed Dodge save, No damage on succesful one
Full Dex Mod for Mainhand Finesse Damage Rolls?
Bonus AP - Cunning Action - Hide, Disengage
Cooldown on Second Wind reset on Short Rest
Multi Attack with Heavy, Versatile, or Weapons without the Finesse or Light Property.
Bonus AP - Mighty Action - Shove, Climb, or Leap (Leaper Feat?)
Multi Attack with Ranged and Light and/or Finesse Melee Weapons
Bonus AP - Mental Action - Channel, Skill Check (Int, Wis, Cha)
Technique - Flawless Strikes? - Victims of Attacks that Apply Effects automatically Fail their Saving Throw.
Bonus AP can be used to Attack or Move
Bonus AP can be used to Cast
Bonus AP can be used to Focus or when Preparing a Reaction?
Your Dodge can only increase by a maximum of X from your Dex Bonus while wearing this Armor Type
Dex Skill Checks are made with Disadvantage
If your Str does not meat this value, Weight Penalties are incurred while wearing this Armor
You cannot add any Attribute Bonuses to DCs, or Attack, Damage, Heal, or Shield Rolls.
Concentration Checks are made with Disadvantage
You are Granted a +3 Bonus to Dodge Saving Throws, but take a -1 Penalty to Speed

column4: 2H, Expertise, 20/40 Range, Deadzone, 1/8 Loading, Quick Loading
This 2 Handed Weapon can be wielded your Main Hand with Lowered Damage.
When Dealing Damage with an Attack or Ability this you can choose to deal Slashing Damage (unless specified otherwise by an Ability)
When Dealing Damage with an Attack or Ability this you can choose to deal Piercing Damage (unless specified otherwise by an Ability)
When Dealing Damage with an Attack or Ability this you can choose to deal Impact Damage (unless specified otherwise by an Ability)
This Weapon can be used to perform the Guard Action or Block a Melee attack.
When performing an Attack with this Weapon, you can choose to Throw it to make a Ranged Attack.
2 of these Weapons can be wielded at once. When Attacking with your Offhand Weapon, you add only Half of your Str/Dex Bonuses to your Attack and Damage Roll Bonuses
When Attacking twice with the same Weapon on the same Turn, the Multi Attack Penalty for this weapon is only -4, not -5.
This Melee Weapon can Attack from X Spaces away
You can make an Attack roll with this Weapon to make the Shove Action instead of using Athletics.
When Attacking with this Weapon you can choose to add either your Str or Dex Mod for Attack Rolls, and either your Str or 1/2 your Dex Mod for Block, Shield, and Damage rolls
When Dealing Critical Damage, the Base Power of this Weapon is Increased (ie: d6 -> d8)
While Sheathed, other Creatures cannot see you have these Weapons unless they pass a DCX Perception Check.
You can attempt to Recover Ammo after firing it
When Performing an Attack with this Weapon against a Target within 1 Space of you, the Attack is no longer made with Disadvantage
The Reload Action with this weapon only costs 1 AP, and moves 1dX Ammo into Available Ammo. If this Weapon can only hold 1 Ammo as Available, no roll is necessary.
This Weapon can be used instead of an open Hand for Somatic Spell Components, and can be Attuned to a Basic Spell.
This Weapon can be attuned with Charges of a Primary Spell.
This Weapon can be made of entirely natural materials
Able to use Interactions or Somatic Spell Components while these Weapons are Unsheathed
This Weapon doesn't roll at Disadvantage when making Attacks while Underwater, but you cannot Attack Enemies Further than your normal Range.
Requires 2AP to perform the Guard Action unless you have at least 17? Str

column3: This is a Ranged Weapon and can be used to Attack or Power Shot from X Spaces away, or Y Spaces away with Disadvantage

This is a Melee Weapon that can be used to Attack from X Spaces away, or Y Spaces away with Disadvantage. When doing so you may your Dex Mod for Attack and Damage Roll Bonuses, regardless of if it has the Finesse Property. You can carry 5 of these Items, and after Throwning 5 many of them, you can no longer use the Item until you Recover at least 1.
This Ranged Weapon can be used for X (Available Ammo) Attacks before you must Reload it. After Y (Reserve Ammo) Attacks you must get more Ammo from your Backpack
This Weapon is wielded with both hands. If you are Proficient in Str, you can add Double your Str Mod to Melee Damage Rolls, or your full Dex Mod for Finesse Weapons.

column5: Radiation or destructive Divine / Holy Damage

column3: The Damage Type of the Damage dealt is based on the Targets' Defenses, changing to the Damage Type that would deal the most Damage. ie: If a Creature is Warded against Frost Damage, and the Source of Damage is Adaptive Frost or Impact, the Damage Type would be Impact.
Damage dealt cannot be reduced be any means except Invulnerability
A magical bond to ones body and mind, which can be pushed beyond its natural limits.
A magical bond to Deity of immense power, born from unwavering trust and faith.
A magical bond to the pure and primordial elemental planes that together combine to create the physical world.
A magical bond to the laws and limitations of the cosmic universe, born from an intense understanding and respect of what happens when they are bent or broken.
A magical bond to the unseen connections of every waking mind, born from an unshakable will and empathic link with others.

A magical bond with the Veil, a plane of the dead, and the spirits of those that reside there. Born from memory/reverance of those lost and the neverending flux of life and death, and the potential for what could happen if this flux were interrupted.
A magical bond to the deepest, most pure state of any natural system, born from knowing life's limitless potential and separating instinct from desire.

column4: Control Elemental, Primal, or Arcane Energy

column3: You have 3 Actions and a possible Bonus Action per Turn, as well as 1 Reaction per Round. Free Actions have no limits so long as you meet the criteria to perform them.
You can Move up to your Speed for each Move Action you take.
You can make one Attack with each equipped Weapon per Attack Action.
Taking the Guard Action makes Block not cost your Reaction until your Next Turn. This also increases the AC Value of your Equipped Shield
You set your Available Ammo to its Maximum, subtracting the difference from your Reserve Ammo. If Dual Wielding, you can Reload both Weapons as part of the same Reload Action.
You can cast a Spell or part of a Spell with an Action. Most Spells require at least 2 Actions.
Maintain the effects of a peristant Spell. This normally requires use of at least 1 free hand or a Casting Weapon.
You use or interact with an item. Wield or Sheath a Weapon, Drink a potion, throw a lever. Most items have an AP cost to use, if not specified it takes only 1 Action.

You Roll Stealth to try and disappear from sight. When Hiding while in Line of Sight of an Enemy, you roll higher than their passive Perception to see if they notice you Hiding, or ignore your Hide altogether.
You spend time carefully assessing how to safely move, Move 1 Space, this does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity
Generate WP based on your Focus Secondary Stat
You Grant Advantage on an Ally's next Skill Check or Attack Roll.
Contested Athletics Check against Opponents' Athletics/Acrobatics Skill. On a Failure Applies Immobilize. Grappling a Immobilized Target Applies Restrained (Channeled).
An Action that can be taken once per Round, even when it is not your Turn, but can only be used by filling a certain criteria.
If an Enemy performs a Reload Action while in your Melee Weapon's Reach, or Moves out of it Without taking the Disengage Action, you can use your Reaction to make a Normal Melee Attack against them.

If an Attack Roll Hits you, you can choose to use a Reaction to roll your Shield or Weapon's Block Die + your Str(Dex for Finesse) to Grant yourself a Shield equal to the Roll. If this is a Spell Attack or Ranged Attack, you can Block with a Shield, but not a Weapon.

You can forgo your Actions on your Turn, and use your Reaction to perform an Action costing 1-2 AP. You must provide a criteria to do so. ie: If an enemy comes around this corner, I'll Prepare an Attack.
A special Action that does not Cost AP or your Reaction, even when it is not your Turn, but can only be used by filling a certain criteria.
The duration of Combat it takes for Character to perform their Actions
The duration of Combat it takes for all Characters to perform their Turns
The order in which Characters take their Turns, decided when engaging in Combat. This order can be shifted by some Skills
The amount of Time an Ability takes before being able to use the Ability again. These Cooldowns are reduced by 1 Turn at the beginning of your Turn.
A Magical Ability that is Casted. If an Item is used to Cast the Spell, the Item has Charges and Recharges based on the Rarity of the Item. Casting in this way does not Require WP.
A simple Spell Attuned to a Caster Weapon, generally less powerful but does not require WP to cast.
An Ability that behaves like a Melee Weapon Weapon Attack
An Ability that behaves like a Ranged Weapon Weapon Attack
This Ability that requires a Weapon and inherits Damage, Attack, and Range rules from the Weapon used to Perform it
An Ability that must roll equal to or higher than the Target's AC to hit
This Ability uses both Equiped Weapons when Dual Wielding, normally
An Ability that behaves like a Spell, but uses one's Natural Ability, rather than Spellcasting. May still require Spell Components.
The Target must roll Dodge equal or higher than the DC of the Ability to reduce or negate the effects.
The Target must roll Fortitude equal or higher than the DC of the Ability to reduce or negate the effects.
The Target must roll Resistance equal or higher than the DC of the Ability to reduce or negate the effects.
The DC of this Ability is based on an Atribute. 8 + Stat (ie: Cha, Int, etc.)
The DC of this Ability is based on the Modifier used during the Weapon Attack that applies the Effect. 8 + Dex/Str
This Ability does not incur Multi Attack Penalties from using the same Weapon to Attack on the same Turn.
An Ability that requires a variable amount of Actions to use, Costing additional AP to Alter the Ability.

An Ability that has ongoing Effects as long as Concentration is maintained. You must succeed a Fortitude Save when you lose HP to maintain Concentration. The DC is equal to 10 or Half the amount of HP lost, whichever is Higher.
An Ability that can be used X times, each use incurring it's own Cooldown.

An Ability whose Effects persist for up to X Turns, each Turn Costs Y AP (generally 1) to maintain the Ability. The CD does not start until the Channel completes or is Interrupted. You must succeed a Fortitude Save when Damaged to maintain Channeling. The DC is 10 or Half of the Damage Taken, whichever is Higher.
This Spell has a Verbal Component, and cannot be Cast while Silenced.
This Spell has a Somatic Component requiring an Open Hand or a Spellcasting Weapon, and is difficult to Cast while Restrained.
This Spell has a Material Component, and requires consumable Reagents to Cast.

This Ability has different States that change how it behaves. Innate States are the default if you have not purposefully changed it, if you forget the State it was left in, or the State it reverts to after Resting, if you choose.
An Ability that can be used X times before incurring a Cooldown. Each use of the Skill may have different Effects. If not used again within Y Actions, the Cooldown Starts.
(Area of Effect) Hits targets in a Circle, originating from the caster
Hits targets in an Aoe, originating from the Target Space
Hits targets in a cone, starting small from its origin, and growing as it expands further
Affects all Targets in an X Space thick Line from the origin Space on the shortest path to the Target Space. No X = 1
Hits first target in the direction fired
This Ability's Projectile is lobbed and can be tossed over obstacles and Targets to ones behind them
This Abilitiy's Projectile can bounce off surfaces, each bounce reduces the distance traveled by 1/2 of the difference of the origin to the target space
Ability Affects the Target, then Chains to an adjacent Target, up to X Targets.
This Spell Targets a Space, not a Creature.
The Targeted Area originates from the Creature using this Ability
A conditional, sometimes temporary, Rule that affects a Creature, Area, or Item
Applies a Control Effect to the Target that hinders their Actions or Movement
When a Status Effect Expires, is Removed, or Consumed
When a Status Effect Ends by completing its Duration
Ends an Effect, normally willingly, and resulting in another Effect
Ends an Effect, normally willingly, and resulting in another Effect
The effect can be applied multiple times with increasing severity
The effect can be applied multiple times increasing the duration of the effect
Physical, True Damage, Stacking Severity, Removed when receiving Healing if the Target is not Wounded
Fire, Stacking Duration, Removed by using 2 AP to pat out the Flames
Dark, Disease, Stacking Severity, Damage based on HP

Temporarily lowers the Afflicted Target's Max HP, any Healing Dealt to them must first increase their Max HP to their original Max before increasing their Current HP. Also normally Heals Undead Creatures and Increases their Max HP
Decreases Damage, Shielding, or Healing Dealt by X Damage Die. Each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1.

Decreases Healing received by Half, and prevents Healing from Increasing Max HP on Creatures with Necrosis, or from removing Bleed Effects when the Target of the Bleed is not Wounded. The End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Disadvantage on all Saving Throws and Attribute Checks
Decreases Armor and Protection by X. Each Attack that Hits this Target or the End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1

The Target takes an additional Half Damage from a certain Damage Type. IE: 9 Damage with Vulnerability would be increased to 13. Each time the Target takes Vulnerable Damage or the End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Disadvantage on Attack Rolls. Each Attack Roll Made or the End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Attackers are Granted Advantage. Each Attack Roll made against this Target or the End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Lowers Speed by X. The End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Move back once in Initiative and reduces max AP by 1. The End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
The Target is compelled to attack the source of the Taunt, and rolls Attacks with Disadvantage against all other Targets. Each Attack Roll Made or the End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Prevents Movement and Applies Disadvantage to Dodge Saving Throws. The End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Prevents all Actions but Crawl Movement. You can also use a Move Action to Stand. While Prone Melee Attacks against you are made with Advantage but you are considered in Partial Cover.
Moves the Target X Spaces, either Pushing or Pulling, against their Will. This Movement does not Provoke Attacks of Opportunity.

The Range of Spells and Ranged Attacks is lowered to Half their normal Range. Also, all Attack Rolls are made with Disadvantage and you can no longer Cast or Ranged Attack at increased range which would normally incur the Disadvantage Penalty. The End of each Turn Lowers this Effect by -1
Prevents all actions, Attacks against you are made with Advantage and any Attacks that Hit are automatically Considered Critical Hits. You automatically Fail any Dodge Saving Throws.
Prevents use of Weapon Attacks and Weapon Based Abilities. Your Weapon is thrown to a nearby Space and must be Interacted with.

You are susceptable to suggestions from the Creature that Charmed you, and they are Granted Advantage on Charisma Checks against you. If you cause Damage or Apply a Negative Status Effect to an Ally, this Effect Ends.
You randomly use your Actions based on the Confusion Table...
The Creature that Applied the Domination Effect now controls the Target Creature.
Prevents use of Spells with Verbal Components.

If Concentrating on, Channeling, or Casting an Ability and are the victim of a Control Impairing Effect, this Stops this Ability from being used, sets that Ability on CD, or stops the Channel early, and starts the CD early.
You may not move towards the Source of the Fear unless you roll Resist, and roll Disadvantage on any roll against the Target who feared you
You cannot take any action, or receive any damage, healing, buffs, or debuffs.
Start your next Turn with X less AP.
Unable to Move, Attack, or use Abilities with Somatic Components. Attacks against you are made with Advantage, and your Dodge Saving Throws are made with Disadvantage.
Unable to Move, Attacks against the Creature Grappling you are made with Disadvantage, Attacks against you by the Creature Grappling you are made with Advantage.
Unable to use any Actions. Melee Attacks against you cause you to Fail 2 Death Saving Throws immediately.
Damage Taken decreases your Shield before it can decrease HP
Increases Damage or Healing dealt by 1 Damage Die
Increases Damage or Healing by X or XdY, this is also affected by Empower.
Increases healing taken to the maximum of any Dice Roll
Move up once in Initiative and Grants 1 max AP
Removes and Grants Immunity to most Control Effects
Can't be Displaced, or Knocked Prone

column2: You have an understanding of this Skill or Tool and add the Following to your Checks

column4: Swiming, Climbing, Lifting, Leaping, Moving Heavy Objects

column7: Crafting - Medium Armor, Boots, Belt, Bags
Crafting - Light Armor, Cloaks, Tabards, Clothes/Costumes

column3: Material Items that have been Gathered or Found but not Refined
Items that can be Refined or used in Crafting
Material Items that have been Refined.
A combination of Crafted Material Items that can be used in further Crafting or Salvaged.
Functions as a Component does, but is not made from Crafted Material
Can Salvaged to convert Components or Items into Materials or Components

A property of a Crafting Component that determines properties of the Crafted Item. IE: a Shortsword Blade needs to be made of metal, but a Copper Shortsword Blade vs an Iron Shortsword Blade affect the Stats of the Shortsword you make with your Blacksmithing Skill.

The Material specific to the item being crafted. IE: Basilisk Scaled Armor would require Basilisk Scales. Though these materials also function as their base Primary-Tertiary Material. IE: a Basilisk Scale would still function as a Scale
Essence Obtained from Salvaging Magical Items. The Quality of Essence affects the Rarity of Item Crafted. Rarer Items have more Enhancements/Bonuses.
Material attuned to a Magical Source to provide specific results when Crafting a Magical Item. IE: To guarantee that your Crafted Item has +1 Potency Enhancement, you may need Psychic Essence.
Altering Skills to customize them. Different Alterations require more 'Cost'... TBD by Balancing Spreadsheet

column5: 1st Point unlocks Skill, 2nd Point adds Technique, 3rd Point increases Prime Technique, 4th Point adds Technique, 5th Point increases Prime Technique

column3: Unlocks Ability if Prereqs are met
This part of the Ability always increases when you Alter an Ability with a Technique. IE: Mobility Abilities always increase Range

column6: Spontaneous? (Does not need Unobstructed Line of Sight)

column3: Set Bonuses/Socketing! Applied to items to create Rune Words or Rune Verse (How do I solve issue with Weapon Swapping?)
2, 3, or 5 Runes Socketed in a single Item can give Bonuses in addition to the individual Runes.
1h Weapons/Offhands and Clothing Slots (Legs, Arms, Head, etc.)
A Combination of 2-3 Rune Words in your Items that give another powerful Bonus in addition to the Rune Words AND the individual Runes themsleves.

column15: Affects the base stats of an Armor or Weapon. AC, Protection. or HP for Armor. Attack, Potency, or Damage for Weapons. (+Damage on Caster Weapon Grants X Bonus when Dealing Damage of the Attuned Source/Aspect of Magic, whereas +Damage on Weapons Grants X Bonus whenever Dealing Damage with that Weapon.)

The default Quality of Starter Equipment Casting Weapons, which has reduced Silver Value. Attuned to 1 Basic Spell (Mainhand/2 Hand), and 3 Charges of a Primary Spell (Offhand/2 Hand) for the Original Bound Owner.
Grants +1 to a Single Bonus. Caster Weapons are Attuned to 1 Basic Spell, and Infinite Charges of Primary Spell.
Grants +2 to a Single Bonus, or +1 to Two Bonuses. Caster Weapons are Attuned to 2 Basic Spells, and Infinite Charges of Primary Spell.
Grants +3 to a Single Bonus, or +2 to a Single Bonus and +1 to another Bonus. Caster Weapons are Attuned to 2 Basic Spells, Infinite Charges of 1 Primary Spell, and 1 Charge of a Secondary Spell.
Grants +2 to Two Bonuses, or +3 to a Single Bonus and +1 to another Bonus. Caster Weapons are Attuned to 2 Basic Spells, Infinite Charges of 1 Primary Spell, and 1 Charge of a Secondary Spell.
Grants +3 to a Single Bonus and +2 to another Bonus. Caster Weapons are Attuned to 2 Basic Spells, Infinite Charges of 2 Primary Spell, and 1 Charge of a Secondary Spell.
Grants +3 to Two Bonuses. Caster Weapons are Attuned to 2 Basic Spells, Infinite Charges of 2 Primary Spell, and 3 Charges of a Secondary Spell.

column3: Affects the number of, and increases of Bonus stats from Magical Effects...
Static Bonuses based on Item or previous Bound Owner. Maybe some drawbacks? Limit 3

Powerful Items with dangerous drawbacks. Bound to the Creature that Equips, who is compelled not to Unequip it until the Curse is somehow removed. Limit 1, can also be Unique and counts toward that Limit.

No Bonuses necessarily, but an item that is Enchanted with a Spell, or the default Rarity for any casting weapon/focus. For instance a Scroll that contains a Spell, or a Potion containing Magical Ingredients

column12: The default Quality of Starter Equipment Casting Weapons, which has reduced Silver Value. Attuned to 1 Basic Spell (Mainhand/2 Hand), and 3 Charges of a Primary Spell (Offhand/2 Hand) for the Original Bound Owner.
Your Choice of 3 Prefixes, 2 Affixes, and 1 Spell Technique on OH/2H. Cannot be Unbound from the Creature that Equips it until that Creature Dies.
Weapons/Armor only - Your Choice of 3 Prefixes, 2 Affixes, 1 Spell Technique on OH/2H, and 1 Spell Technique on MH/2H. Cannot be Unbound from the Creature that Equips it until that Creature Dies.

column3: Uncommon or Rarer Worn Equpment Grants Protective Bonuses. HP, AC, Dodge, etc. Limited to 1 Item per slot, 3 Magical+ pieces total.
Uncommon or Rarer Worn Jewelery Grants Offensive Bonuses. Accuracy, Potency, etc. Limited to 3 Magical+ pieces total.
Grants Utility Bonuses. Tool Slots, Inventory Slots, Carrying Capacity, etc. Does not count toward Magic Item Limitations

column5: Mat not be necessary with scrolls/consumes

column3: Toolkit, Rope, Torch, Scroll, etc. Something that can be interacted with that doesn't need to be removed from a backpack.
Consumables that cast a Single Spell
Behave like Scrolls but the Spell Recharges.
Casting Focus, Shield, or 1h Weapon (if able to Dual Wield)
Adds to Damage of Modifier, Default Damage Type unless specified
Adds a Damage Dice, Default Damage Type unless specified

column4: Reroll 1 Prefix of your choice to your choice of Prefix
Reroll 1 Affix of your choice to your choice of Affix

column3: Larger groups that fall under a Class. IE: Undead is Class, Zombie is Subclass
Mostly looks/feel, with minor mechanical adjustments. IE: Graveyard Zombie vs. Drowned Pirate Zombie
A Magical Affix unique to this Enemy Group... Maybe?
Bonus Stagger when Countering, Vuln Resist
Interrupt Armor prevents a Creature from being Affected by Control Effects. A Creature has at least 1 Interrupt Armor, and gains an Additional 1 for each X 'Stamina' that they have.
When a Creature loses an Interrupt Armor, they are Interrupted if in the middle of an Ability or Attack. If a Creature has no Interrupt Armor, they are susceptible to Control Effects.
Creatures lose Stamina from taking Damage, Blocking, Dodging, or Sprinting.
Emphasis should be on having compelling things happen while traveling specific where players are in the world or story

column4: should at the very least give insight into an enemy type or to the area  traveled through. Think flora and fauna
provide details about the area, perhaps lore, flora, fauna
introduce a new character tied to the area or callback an old character

column23: Empower +1 against Unarmored. Applies Bleed +2, or +1 on a Failed Fort Save
Empower +1 against Shield, Advantage against Structures or Guarding Targets.
Empower +1 against Armored, Trade Disadvantage for Max Damage
Attack an Additional Target within Range
Apply Expose or Disarm a Shield?
Increase Reach by 1 Space as part of a Melee Attack
Empower +2, Splash 2 Spaces on Failed Fort Save
Empower +1, Applies Prone or Restrain if your Target is between you and an Obstacle
Ends all Bleed Effects, dealing their Damage instantly.
Empower +1, Deals Max Damage against Wounded Targets
Grant +1 Empower for each Ammo Consumed up to 3
Reaction to Attack before an Enemy within X Spaces Draws or makes an Attack on You
